name: Augustine
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
September 2023
,
·
Stayed with a pet
review_text: 1st things 1st my girls were happy from the start! House was a warm comfortable fishing cabin, but that is kind of a understatement. The view from the back towards the lake was amazing! And at night you could see the bright LED lights from the UTVs cruising around the lake and people just enjoying life. During the day the restaurants in Zapata were perfect! BUT our host Tony was a all around life saver! I wasn’t in town for fish, I was there to do work on our dear lease in Falcon. Camping just wasn’t a option for my girls especially in this heat in Texas, but nonetheless I had work to get done. During our adventure miles from the nearest highway 83 I had a blowout in my 4x4. I was able to get the spare on and get back to the main road but wasn’t feeling comfortable with the old wanky spare. So I reached out to Tony just for a recommendation. Holy smokes the people treated us like family replaced 2 tires and got us back on the road. Couldn’t have gone any better. Thanks Tony! HERO!

review_text: Great find! Absolutely nice place to stay with a view of the lake. The home was very clean, with everything we needed to cook. The beds, pillows and sofas were all very soft and comfortable. Everything was so clean and smelled nice and refreshing. We took a little kiddie pool for out toddlers and set it up in the bbq area/balcony. Took an ATV and used that to access the lake as it was quite a distance from the home. We really enjoyed ourselves and appreciate the cleanliness and decor. Would recommend Tony's place for a nice family getaway.

The bed was comfortable and the split air/heat unit helped to drown out the loud music.

name: Todd
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
February 2024
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Bring your paper goods and zip locks bags.
Bring your can of propane for the grill.
Bring some kitchen linens for washing dishes. Bring a 12 cup coffee maker,coffee, creamer, and sugar if you have more than 1 person. A/C and heat worked great! TV was great! The awning with lights was great for rigging baits and doing boat stuff at night. The gate is a little tight for a 21ft bassboat but we got it in there. We had a good time and will come back. Just make sure if you use the ramp in town that when you go to the main channel go around the red things. Either on left or right. DO NOT go between there is a bridge underwater about a foot you can’t see!!!

James was super accommodating for us. 6 of us got into town super late and we’re looking for a place to stay. We found James place and booked at around 2130. He confirmed within minutes and agreed to give us immediate check in. He allowed the 6 of us to stay in the room using the two beds and an available air mattress.
The room was very clean, nicely decorated and had a great shower. Would definitely stay again.

Stayed over a week
review_text:
I travel for work and usually try to get an Airbnb whenever I’m out on the road just for more privacy and to feel as if I’m in a home away from home. This one is perfect. Being close to a grocery store, restaurants and gas stations was very nice especially since they are on the route to the Airbnb when traveling from San Ygnacio. Also, it is very quiet inside of the Airbnb too.
I am looking forward to staying here again for another long term reservation.

name: Rafael

April 2022
,
·
Stayed with kids
review_text: Noe is an extremely humble and respectful man. His home is beautiful. I experienced a very relaxing environment and he respected me and my families space, half of the time I forgot he lived so close to us. It’s so clean in his place that it encouraged me to keep the place clean. It was super organized. Bed was super comfy. Sheets was nice and felt premium. AC was spot on. Driveway access super easy and you’re right there in the middle of town. Couldn’t have had a better stay here in Zapata. Thank you Noe!
